meanings.definition: A representation of a person or thing, typically on a smaller scale.
meanings.sent1: She built a model of the solar system for her science project.
meanings.sent2: The architect used a model to show how the new building would look.
meanings.sent3: The tiny model of the Eiffel Tower made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a model for others to follow.
meanings.sent5: The detailed model of the car was incredibly lifelike.

meanings.definition: A person employed to display clothes by wearing them.
meanings.sent1: The fashion show featured a model wearing the latest designs.
meanings.sent2: She aspired to become a successful model in the fashion industry.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy model accidentally tripped on the runway.
meanings.sent4: She strutted down the catwalk like a professional model.
meanings.sent5: The elegant model showcased the designer's collection beautifully.

meanings.definition: A simplified description, especially a mathematical one, of a system or process.
meanings.sent1: The teacher used a model to explain the complex math problem.
meanings.sent2: The diagram provided a clear model of how the experiment would be conducted.
meanings.sent3: The playful student created a model of the equation using colorful blocks.
meanings.sent4: Her methodical approach served as a model for solving similar equations.
meanings.sent5: The visual model helped the students understand the scientific concept better.
